properties.description: ID of the model to use.
properties.label: Model
properties.name: model

properties.description: Format of providing the prompt to the model.
properties.label: Format
properties.name: format

options.description: User prompt and optional system prompt.
options.label: Simple

options.description: Full control over the messages sent to the model.
options.label: Advanced

properties.description: User prompt to the model.
properties.label: Prompt
properties.name: userPrompt

properties.description: System prompt to the model.
properties.label: System Prompt
properties.name: systemPrompt

properties.description: Only text and image files are supported. Also, only certain models supports images. Please check the documentation.
properties.label: Attachments
properties.name: attachments

properties.description: A list of messages comprising the conversation so far.
The role of the messages author.
properties.label: Role
properties.name: role

properties.description: The contents of the message.
properties.label: Content
properties.name: content

properties.description: Only text and image files are supported. Also, only certain models supports images. Please check the documentation.
properties.label: Attachments
properties.name: attachments

properties.label: Messages
properties.name: messages

properties.description: The response from the API.
properties.label: Response
properties.name: response

properties.description: In which format do you want the response to be in?
properties.label: Response Format
properties.name: responseFormat

options.description: Response as data in a simple format using keys and values
options.label: Structured data

properties.description: Define desired structure for the structured data response.
properties.label: Response Schema
properties.name: responseSchema

properties.description: Controls how long the model will stay loaded into memory following the request
properties.label: Keep alive for
properties.name: keepAlive

properties.description: Maximum number of tokens to predict when generating text. (-1 = infinite generation, -2 = fill context)
properties.label: Num predict
properties.name: maxTokens

properties.description: Controls randomness:  Higher values will make the output more random, while lower values like will make it more focused and deterministic.
properties.label: Temperature
properties.name: temperature

properties.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling,  where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
properties.label: Top P
properties.name: topP

properties.description: Specify the number of token choices the generative uses to generate the next token.
properties.label: Top K
properties.name: topK

properties.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.
properties.label: Frequency Penalty
properties.name: frequencyPenalty

properties.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.
properties.label: Presence Penalty
properties.name: presencePenalty

properties.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.
properties.label: Stop
properties.name: stop

properties.description: Keeping the same seed would output the same response.
properties.label: Seed
properties.name: seed

properties.description: Whether to use NUMA.
properties.label: Use NUMA
properties.name: useNuma

properties.description: Sets the size of the context window used to generate the next token.
properties.label: Num CTX
properties.name: numCtx

properties.description: Prompt processing maximum batch size.
properties.label: Num batch
properties.name: numBatch

properties.description: The number of layers to send to the GPU(s). On macOS it defaults to 1 to enable metal support, 0 to disable. 1 here indicates that NumGPU should be set dynamically
properties.label: Num GPU
properties.name: numGpu

properties.description: When using multiple GPUs this option controls which GPU is used for small tensors for which the overhead of splitting the computation across all GPUs is not worthwhile. The GPU in question will use slightly more VRAM to store a scratch buffer for temporary results.
properties.label: Main GPU
properties.name: mainGpu

properties.description: Return logits for all the tokens, not just the last one. To enable completions to return logprobs, this must be true.
properties.label: Logits all
properties.name: logitsAll

properties.description: Load only the vocabulary, not the weights.
properties.label: Vocab only
properties.name: vocabOnly

properties.description: By default, models are mapped into memory, which allows the system to load only the necessary parts of the model as needed. However, if the model is larger than your total amount of RAM or if your system is low on available memory, using mmap might increase the risk of pageouts, negatively impacting performance. Disabling mmap results in slower load times but may reduce pageouts if youâ€™re not using mlock. Note that if the model is larger than the total amount of RAM, turning off mmap would prevent the model from loading at all.
properties.label: Use MMap
properties.name: useMmap

properties.description: Lock the model in memory, preventing it from being swapped out when memory-mapped. This can improve performance but trades away some of the advantages of memory-mapping by requiring more RAM to run and potentially slowing down load times as the model loads into RAM.
properties.label: Use MLock
properties.name: useMlock

properties.description: Sets the number of threads to use during computation. By default, Ollama will detect this for optimal performance. It is recommended to set this value to the number of physical CPU cores your system has (as opposed to the logical number of cores). 0 = let the runtime decide
properties.label: Num thread
properties.name: numThread

properties.description: Tail-free sampling is used to reduce the impact of less probable tokens from the output. A higher value (e.g., 2.0) will reduce the impact more, while a value of 1.0 disables this setting.
properties.label: Tfs Z
properties.name: tfsz

properties.description: Sets how far back for the model to look back to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx)
properties.label: Repeat last N
properties.name: repeatLastN

properties.description: Sets how strongly to penalize repetitions. A higher value (e.g., 1.5) will penalize repetitions more strongly, while a lower value (e.g., 0.9) will be more lenient.
properties.label: Repeat penalty
properties.name: repeatPenalty

properties.description: Enable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity. (default: 0, 0 = disabled, 1 = Mirostat, 2 = Mirostat 2.0)
properties.label: Mirostat
properties.name: mirostat

properties.description: Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. A lower value will result in more focused and coherent text.
properties.label: Mirostat Tau
properties.name: mirostatTau

properties.description: Influences how quickly the algorithm responds to feedback from the generated text. A lower learning rate will result in slower adjustments, while a higher learning rate will make the algorithm more responsive.
properties.label: Mirostat Eta
properties.name: mirostatEta

properties.description: URL to your Ollama server
properties.label: Url

description: Get up and running with large language models.
name: ollama
title: Ollama
